title: 111_hr1182
content: The Act titled "Military Spouses Residency Relief Act" guarantees residency for military personnel spouses for voting purposes. The Servicemembers Civil Relief Act is amended to include provisions for spouses of military personnel regarding voting for Federal, State, or local offices. Absence from a State due to accompanying a spouse under military orders will not affect residency or domicile status in that State or any other State. The Servicemembers Civil Relief Act is amended to include provisions for spouses of military personnel regarding voting for Federal, State, or local offices. Absence from a State due to accompanying a spouse under military orders will not affect residency or domicile status in that State or any other State. Additionally, the table of contents in the Act is updated to reflect these changes. The Servicemembers Civil Relief Act is amended to guarantee residency for military personnel and spouses. This applies to absences from specified States regardless of the military order date. Additionally, there are provisions for determining the residence of spouses of military personnel for tax purposes. The Servicemembers Civil Relief Act is amended to ensure that spouses of military personnel do not lose or acquire residency for tax purposes when accompanying the servicemember on military orders. The Servicemembers Civil Relief Act is amended to protect the tax residency status of military spouses accompanying servicemembers on orders. This includes specifying that income earned by a military spouse in a different jurisdiction is not considered income in the United States for tax purposes. The Servicemembers Civil Relief Act is amended to protect the tax residency status of military spouses accompanying servicemembers on orders. The amendments specify that income earned by a military spouse in a different jurisdiction is not considered income in the United States for tax purposes. Subsection (a)(2) and (c) of section 511 of the Act, along with related amendments, apply to state or local income tax returns starting from the enactment of this Act. SEC. 4. SUSPENSION OF LAND RIGHTS RESIDENCY REQUIREMENT FOR SPOUSES OF MILITARY PERSONNEL. An amendment to the Servicemembers Civil Relief Act allows the suspension of land rights residency requirement for spouses of servicemembers in military service. This applies to servicemembers on or after the enactment of this Act.
